thread.title: Jim Lejeal Joins VictorOps as Chief Financial Officer

author: cnbc.com
title: Jim Lejeal Joins VictorOps as Chief Financial Officer
text:
Rapid Growth Strategist Joins Leading Incident Management Vendor
BOULDER, Colo.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- VictorOps , the global leader in full-stack operations management for DevOps teams, announced the appointment of industry veteran Jim Lejeal as chief financial officer. Over the last two years, VictorOps has grown revenue over 210 percent, tripled the size of the company, and landed numerous Fortune 500 customers.
“As VictorOps prepares for another year of significant growth, Jim’s skill set will be critical to organic and inorganic expansion. With prior experience as a key member of the Rally Software executive team, he is extremely familiar with the software development and operations industry,” said Todd Vernon, co-founder and chief executive officer of VictorOps. “The explosive growth of the DevOps market is a natural next step for customers of Agile software solutions, and Jim has extensive experience with emerging markets and public offerings.”
“Pushing code to production faster is necessary to stay competitive. When it comes to incident management software that supports both DevOps teams and continuous uptime, VictorOps is the clear market leader,” said Jim Lejeal. “Similar to Agile, DevOps supports high-performing teams, resiliency, and efficiency. Helping teams deliver business value faster has been a cornerstone of my career. I’m excited to join this amazing company.”
Jim’s tenure at Rally included technology acquisitions, optimizing the business for Rally’s Initial Public Offering in 2013, and playing an instrumental role in Rally’s successful sale to CA Technologies in 2015.
Leading multiple companies through both the rapid growth stage and the IPO process, Jim’s 20 years of experience as a software fundraiser are a natural fit for the accomplished VictorOps executive team. A successful entrepreneur himself, Jim founded and managed multiple technology companies.
Prior to joining VictorOps, Jim served as CFO at Sphero, Inc. His other roles include CFO at Rally Software Development Corp; co-founder and CFO at Raindance Communications Inc.; corporate vice president of finance at ConferTech International; and advisor at Techstars Central LLC. He holds a B.S. degree in management from the U.S. Air Force Academy and an MBA from Loyola Marymount University.
About VictorOps
VictorOps is incident management software purpose-built for DevOps. From fast forensics to rapid remediation, we empower engineering and operations teams to work together, solve problems faster, and continuously improve in high-velocity deployment environments.
